de.tschebbischeff.model

Class CelestialBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.tschebbischeff.model.CelestialBody

  • public class CelestialBody
extends java.lang.Object
    Models celestial bodies. These can be put on an orbit, as well as have other orbits around them.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Tarek

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Vector3d axisOfRotation
      The axis of rotation around which this body rotates.
      private double mass
      The mass of this celestial body.
      private Orbit orbit
      The orbit of this celestial body.
      private double orbitalOffset
      The offset at time zero, this planet has on its orbit.
      private OrientationCache orientationCache
      Caches the last result of the calculation of the orientation.
      private PositionCache positionCache
      Caches the last result of the calculation of the position.
      private double radius
      The radius of this celestial body.
      private double rotationalOffset
      The offset at time zero, this planets rotation has.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CelestialBody

        public CelestialBody()
        Creates a new star.

      • CelestialBody

        public CelestialBody(Orbit orbit)
        Creates a new celestial body on the given orbit. If the orbit is null, this celestial body is classified as a star.
        Parameters:
        orbit - The orbit on which this celestial body moves.

    • Method Detail

      • isStar

        public boolean isStar()
        A star in the context of this model is a celestial body, which has no orbit.
        Returns:
        Whether this body is a star or a satellite.

      • setRadius

        public CelestialBody setRadius(double r)
        Sets the radius of this body
        Parameters:
        r - The radius of this body, which must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        This celestial body for fluent method calls.

      • setMass

        public CelestialBody setMass(double m)
        Sets the mass of this body
        Parameters:
        m - The mass of this body, which must be greater than zero.
        Returns:
        This celestial body for fluent method calls.

      • setAxisOfRotation

        public CelestialBody setAxisOfRotation(Vector3d a)
        Sets the axis of rotation of this body. The axis is seen as relative to the orbital plane.
        Parameters:
        a - The axis around which this body rotates.
        Returns:
        This celestial body for fluent method calls.

      • setOrbitalOffset

        public CelestialBody setOrbitalOffset(double o)
        Sets the orbital offset of this body. Not applicable to stars. The orbital offset defines how much farther than the periapsis the body is located along its orbit at time zero. A value of zero means it is located at its periapsis, a value of 0.5 means it is located at half the orbit.
        Parameters:
        o - The orbital offset of this body. Must be in the interval [0,1).
        Returns:
        This celestial body for fluent method calls.

      • setRotationalOffset

        public CelestialBody setRotationalOffset(double r)
        Sets the rotational offset of this body. The rotational offset defines how much the body is already rotated around its axis of rotation at time zero. A value of zero means it is not rotated around itself, a value of 0.5 means it has done half a rotation already.
        Parameters:
        r - The rotational offset of this body. Must be in the interval [0,1).
        Returns:
        This celestial body for fluent method calls.

      • getRadius

        public double getRadius()
        Gets the radius of this celestial body
        Returns:
        This body's radius.

      • getMass

        public double getMass()
        Gets the mass of this celestial body
        Returns:
        This body's mass.

      • getAxisOfRotation

        public Vector3d getAxisOfRotation()
        Gets the axis around which this body rotates.
        Returns:
        This body's axis of rotation.

      • getOrbitalOffset

        public double getOrbitalOffset()
        Gets the orbital offset of this body, see setOrbitalOffset(double) for more information regarding the orbital offset.
        Returns:
        The orbital offset of this body as a value between zero and one. Excluding one, inlcuding zero.

      • getRotationalOffset

        public double getRotationalOffset()
        Gets the rotational offset of this body, see setRotationalOffset(double) for more information regarding the rotational offset.
        Returns:
        The rotational offset of this body as a value between zero and one. Excluding one, including zero.

      • getGlobalOrientation

        public Quat4d getGlobalOrientation()
        Gets the orientation of this body in a global context, that is the orientation of its orbital plane combined with its axis of rotation. This orientation does not rotate around the planets axis of rotation depending on time!
        Returns:
        This body's global orientation.

      • getAxialTilt

        public double getAxialTilt()
        Gets the axial tilt of this celestial body.
        Returns:
        This body's axial tilt.

      • getPosition

        public Vector3d getPosition(double time)
        Calculates the position of this celestial body, depending on a time parameter.
        Parameters:
        time - The absolute time at which to calculate the position. Time zero is defined as the time at which all celestial bodies are rotated zero degrees around themselves and at their periapsis, unless the offsets are given.
        Returns:
        The position of the celestial body in a global coordinate system at the given time.

      • getSiderealPeriod

        public double getSiderealPeriod()
        Gets this body's sidereal period. I.e. the time it needs to revolve once on its orbit.
        Returns:
        The sidereal period of this celestial body. Zero for stars.
